headline: Big Rise in Cost Of Birth Control Hits Campuses
snippet: Young women are paying higher prices for prescription contraceptives because of a change in federal law.

headline: Birth Control Pills May Clog Arteries
snippet: Birth control pills taken by about 100 million women worldwide may clog arteries when taken more than 10 years, according to a study. Women on oral contraceptives were 20 percent to 30 percent more likely to have buildup of fat and cholesterol in...

headline: Birth Control for Staten Island's Pigeons?
snippet: To control a pigeon infestation at the St. George ferry terminal, a Staten Island councilman wants the city to use a pesticide that interferes with the ability of eggs to hatch.

headline: Not All Are Pleased at Plan to Offer Birth Control at Maine Middle School
snippet: A school committee’s vote to provide prescription contraceptives at its clinic is drawing fervent support and ardent opposition in Portland.

headline: Birth Control on the Playground?
snippet: Is contraception really necessary in middle school?

headline: Board Allows Birth Control for Middle Schoolers
snippet: The Portland, Me., school board voted to allow middle-school students to gain access to prescription birth control medications without notifying parents.

headline: Birth Control Pill
snippet: A slide show explaining birth control pills.

snippet: A slide show explaining birth control pills.

headline: Barrier Methods of Birth Control
snippet: A slide show explaining barrier methods of birth control.

headline: Agency Approves a Birth Control Pill Halting Periods Indefinitely
snippet: The F.D.A. approved the pill, called Lybrel and made by Wyeth, that can halt menstrual periods indefinitely and prevent pregnancies.

headline: Harsh Birth Control Steps Fuel Violence in China
snippet: An intensive campaign to enforce population-control measures prompted violent clashes between the police and local residents in southwestern China in recent days.

headline: The Crime Rate And Birth Control
snippet: To the Editor:     One reason for the drop in crime in the city that Franklin E. Zimring (''Little Changes, Big Results,'' Op-Ed, April 8) doesn't address is twofold: better access to birth control and the availability of abortion.

headline: Birth Control Coverage
snippet: To the Editor:     While the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit may have ruled that it is not discriminatory for Union Pacific to exclude contraceptive coverage in its health plan, it is clearly fiscally irresponsible (''Court...

headline: Court Says Health Coverage May Bar Birth-Control Pills
snippet: A federal appellate panel ruled that the Union Pacific Railroad Company did not discriminate against its female employees because its insurance did not cover contraception used by men either.

headline: New Rules for Birth Control Are Examined
snippet: The government is considering raising standards for birth control drugs, saying new pills appear to be less effective at preventing pregnancy than those approved decades ago.     The Food and Drug Administration asked a panel of experts on Tuesday...
